column5: Great report Aaron great info as well
Great report!  Surprised at the speed  2.6 mph.  That's salmon speed.

Way to smash em. This has been a prolific year for eyes here. Today our boat went 6 for 8 in a little over 3 hours. As the wind switched from NW to SW the suspended fish hugged bottom. No riggers out today but our buddies were banging the bottom (75') with cannon balls and got them there. We were about 10 miles SE of the stacks which I thing I see in 1 pic. All the fish came of 10 colours with 250 feet of backer out. Black on Gold Ripplin Redfin and Blue on Chrome Reef Runner at around 45 to 50 feet in 75 feet of water. The harnesses on #1 Dipsys were only getting Silvers and stole all the worms so we pulled them and ran minnow baits faster at 2.5 to 3.0 MPH.  I like the plastic clevises on harnesses to reduce line wear and can change blades in a jiffy without changing the entire harness.  I marked a massive amount of fish up and down the water colume in 35' of water, Perch, smallies?? Calling for high winds tonight, tomorrow, those fish better wait for us.  Plenty of fish for everyone, come on down and come back soon Aaron.

Nice haul aaron !!!! Gotta love the harness bite !!!! They just crush em !!!!! All on Colorado blades or any Indiana blades used !!!! I find I can troll a little slower & go deeper if needed when I run the number 5 Indiana blades !!! Thanks for sharing some real nice Erie tankers !!!!! Wow .....
nice job on the eye's Aaron congrats
so insightful, ive saved this thread. Great write up for us rookies.
Wow nice day on the water Aaron. You got me thinking walleye mode now that salmon is over. Few more weeks till we get down to Quinte for late season action.  Cheers
Looks like your off Dunnville Aaron good report ...im now back to doing walleye charters its not salmon but still fun ...
